bibl.title: In Re: Ex Parte - Donald Kerracher - Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT, FOR THE NINTH JUIDICIAL CIRCUIT, WESTERN DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. Petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
TO THE HONORABLE, THE ABOVE ENTITLED COURT, AND CORNELIUS H. HANFORD, Judge of the same: -

Comes now your petitioner, Donald MC Kerracher, a citizen of the United States and of the State of Washington, and respectfully shows to your Honorable Court that he is unlawfully held in custody by C.B. Hopkins, United States Marshal for the District of Washington, in the United States penitentiary at McNeil's Island, in said State of Washington and within this District.-
II-

That your petitoner was sentenced upon the 14th day of January, 1902, and arrived at said penitentiary and was then incarcerated on the 15th day of Janurary, 1902. That the sentence of the court before whom your petitioner was tried was that he should be confined in said penitentiary for the period of five,(5), years, and your petitioner has been incarcerated in said penitentiary under said sentence ever since his incarceration in said 15th day of January, 1902, and that all times since his incarceration in said penitentiary he has been a good prisoner, and for the record of his conduct shows that he has faithfully observed all of the rules and has not been subjected to punishment, and that he is entitled to a deduction from the term of his sentence to be estimated under the laws of the United States of America as commencing on the first day of his arrival at the penitentiary, which deduction, under the law of the United States of America, amounts to eight(8) days for each month of his sentence.
III
That your petitioner has not been sentenced under more than one sentence, but is incarcerated in said penitentiary under one sentence alone.
IIII

That under and by virtue of said sentence, and the condition and terms thereof, and the laws of the United States of America, your petitioner is entitled to a discharge from said penitentiary, and was so entitled to a discharge therefrom upon the 15th day of Septmenber, A.D.1905, is more fully shown by annexed report of O.P. Heligan?, Warden of the Government Penitentiary at McNeils Island, which is hereto annexed, marked " Exhibit A". and made part hereof: but that said United States Marshall refuses to discharge your petitioner from said penitentiary, although his time for which he was sentenced, after deducting "good time", as provided by the laws of the United States of America, has fully expired.
V

That your petitioner is a man of well established reputation, and was so at the time of his sentence. That he is in all respects entitled to the benefits of every law the United States providing for the incarceration and discharge of prisoners sentenced from any quarter of the United States to any jail or penitentiary therein.
Wherefore, your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may issue out of and under the seal of this Honorable Court, directed to C.B. Hopkins, United States Marshal for this District, commanding him to have the body of your petitioner, together with the return of the date and cause of his detention, before this Honorable Court on a day to be designated therein, and that on such return and hearing had thereon, your petitioner may be discharged from said custody and imprisonment. And your petitioner will ever pray.
Donald Mc Kerracher by J.B. Metcalfe his Atty.
United States of America, Ninth Judicial District, State of Washington, County of King, ss.

J.B. Metcalfe, being first duly sworn, on oath deposes and says: That he is attorney for the petitioner above named: has read the foregoing petition, knows the contents thereof, and the facts therein stated are true. That he makes this affidavit upon behalf of the petitioner because the petitioner is now incarcerated in the penitentirary at McNeill's Island and cannot personally make this affidavit.
J.B. Metcalfe
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 18th of September, A.D. 1905.
"Exhibit A"
United States of America, Government Penitentiary, McNeil's Island
To the U.S. Marshall,
Seattle, Wash.
Dear Sir:-

Donald MC Kerracher arrived at the penitentiary on the 15th day of January, 1902, and since said time has been a good and trusted prisoner, nad has not subjected himself to punishment of any kind, but is entitled to the cull? good time provided by law, whatever that may be dteremined to be.
If he is entitled to good time under the law of 1908, the same should be figured as follows:
Date of Sentence - 1902-1-14
Sentence - 5- 0-0
Expiration - 1907 - 1-13 Without "Good Time"
Arrival @ Penitentiary 1902-1-15
" Good Time" allowed on 4 -11-28 = 58/28/ 30mo. @ 8 days per mo. =480
Expiration of Sentence 1907 - 1- 13 Without " Good Time"
" Good Time" 480 days = 1 - 4-0
Expiration of Sentence 1905 - 9 - 13 With "Good Time" Allowance
and unclear this law he is entitled to discharge on the 13th of September, 1905m but you will understand that I do not attempt to determine wheter he is entitled to good time under the law of 1902.
Very respectfully, ....
United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington Western District. M... vs. D. No. 1328, Appearance.
To the Clerk of the above Entitled Court:
You will please enter appearance as attorneys for defendant in the above entitled cause and you will please attest the writ of habeas corpus issued in good cause?. Metcalfe and Jurey
In the United StatesCirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. Petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
The United States of America, To C.B. Hopkins, United States Marshal, GREETING:

We hereby command you that the body of Donald McKerracher, in your custody detained, as it is said, by whatever name he may charged, together with the date and cause of his detention, you have before the United States Circuit Court for the Ninth Judicial District holding terms at Seattle, Washington, in the City of Seattle, County of King and State of Washington, on the 20th day of September, next at ten o'clock in the forenoon of that day, then and there to receive and submit to all and singular whatsover the said Court shall consider concerning him in this behalf, and that you have then and there this writ, with your doings in the premises. Witness the Honorable C.H. Hanford, Judge of said Court, this 18th day of September, A.D. 1905.
C.H. Hanford, Judge
C.H. Hanford, Judge
Attest: A. Reeves Ayres Clerk of said Court, by Rm. H. Briker Deputy
Form No. 282.
Return on Service of Writ
United States of America, Western Distriict of Washington,
I hereby cewrtify and return that in obedience of the well.. writ I have the body of Donald MC Kerrachernow before the Honorable United States Circuit.
Seattle, Sept, 20, 1905.
C.B. Hopkins, U.S. Marshal
by John Stringer, Deputy.
In the United States Circuit Court for the Ninth Circuit Dirstrict of Washington Northern Division

Donald Mc. Kerracher, Petitioner. Complainant vs. Defendant. Petition for a writ of Habeas Corpus. Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 18 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep. Metcafe 7 Jurey, Room 417, etc., Pacific Block, Seattle, Wash. Attorneys for Petitioners. U.S. Marshal's Civil Docket No 2081
In the United StatesCirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. No. 1328
Exceptions.

Comes now the United States of America and Charles C. Hokpins, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, respondents in the above entitled matter, by Jesse A. Frye, United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington, and duly except to the order of disacharge made and entered in the above entitled matter on the 20th day of September 1905, for the reasons and upon the grounds following, to wit:
I. That Court erred in finding that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, was wrongfully restrained of his liberty,
II. The Court erred in finding that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, was unlawfully held in custody by the United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington.
III. The Cout erred in holding and finding that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, was unlawfully held in custody by the Warden of the United States Penitentiary on McNeil's Island, Washington.
IV.The Cout erred in holding and finding that the terms of imprisonment of the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, had expried as provided by law.

V. The Court erred in ordering and adjusting that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, was entitled to be discharged from the cusotdy of the United States Marshal for the Western District of Wahsington.
VI. The Court erred in ordering and directing the United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington to discharge said petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, from custody and imprisonment/
VII. The Court erred in ordering and directing that the petitoner, Donald Mc Keeracher, be discharged from the United States penitentiary on McNeil's Island, Washington.
VIII. The Court erred in ordering the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, to be released from the custody of the officers of the United States.
IX. The Court erred in releasing and discharging the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, from the custody of the officers of the United States and restoring him to liberty.
X. The Said order of discharge is not supported by the law controlling in the premises,
XI. That said order of discharge is contrary to the facts in the premises.
XII. That said order of discharge is not warranted by, nor supported by, the facts, nor by the law in the premises, but is contrary thereto.
Dated this 20th day of September 1905.
Jesse A. Ayres, United States Attorney.
Due and timely service of the within Exceptions, and the receipt of a true copyh thereof, acknowledged this 20th day of September 1905.
Metcalfe and Jurey, Attorneys for Petitioner.
In the United StatesCirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner.
Exceptions
Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 18 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep.
In the United States Cirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. Demurrer to return

Comes now your petitioner, Donald MC Kerracher, and respectfully demure to the return of C.B. Hopkins, United States Marshal, to the Writ of Habeas Corpus issued herein, for the following reasons, to wit:
1. That said Return does not state facts sufficient to constitute a valid return to said Writ.
11. That said Return shows on its facethat the petitioner is restrained of his liberty after the time for which he was sentenced, deducting "Good Time", so by law provided, has expried.
111. That said Return is insufficient in law to justify the further imprisonment of your petitioner.

1V. That said Return shows upon its facts that your petitioner is imprisoned and restrained of his liberty without due process of law, and in conflict with the Statutes and Acts of Congress of the United States of America.
Respectfully submitted,
J.B. Metcalfe
Attorney for Petitioner
United State of America, Ninth Judicial District, State of Washington, County of King. SS

J.B. Metcalfe, attorney for the petitioner, Donald McKerracher, respctfully certifies that he also prepared the foregoing Demurrer, and is familiar with the senteence thereof, and that the same is well taken in point of law
In the United StatesCirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner.
In the United States Circuit Court for the Ninth Circuit Dirstrict of Washington Northern Division

Donald Mc. Kerracher, Petitioner. Complainant vs. Defendant. Demurrer to Return. Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 18 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep. Metcafe 7 Jurey, Room 417, etc., Pacific Block, Seattle, Wash. Attorneys for Petitioners. U.S. Marshal's Civil Docket No 2081
We hereby admit due and proper service of the foregoing Demurrer adn recepit of a copy of the same this 20 day of Sept. 1905,. Jesse A. Frays Attorney for respondents.
In the United StatesCirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner.
In the United StatesCirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. No. 1328.
Petitioner for Appeal to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and Order allowing same.
To the Honorable Cornelius H. Hanford,
Judge of the above entitled Court:

Comes now Charles B. Hopkins, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington and United States of America, respondents in the above entitled matter, by theri attorney, Jesse A Frye, United States Attorney for the Western Distrcit of Washington, and feeling and deeming thesmevles aggrieved by the order and judgement of discharge made, entered and filed in the above enetield proceeding on the 20th day of September 1905, do hereby appeal from the said order and judgement of discharge, to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and pray that their appeal may be allowed and that a transcript of the record and all proceedings and paper upon which said order and judgement was made and entered, duly authenticated may be sent to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit:
Petitioners respectfully pray that on account thereof, their appeal be allowed, to correct the errors complained of, and to reverse, annul and set aside the said order and judgemetn.

Your petitioners further say that they have this day filed herein their assignment of errors committed by the above entitled court in this proceeding, and intented to be urged by your petitoners as appelants in the prosecution of this suit upon appeal:

Your petitoners further show that this appeal is prosecuted by and under the direction and the authority of the Attorney general of the United States of America, and on behalf of the United States of America, and said Charles B. Hopkins, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington: and they respectfully pray that the said appeal may be allowed without bond.
Dated at Seattle, Washington, this 20th day of September 1905.
Jesse A. Fraye
United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington.
Due and timely service of teh within motion, and the receipt of a true copy thereof, acknowledged this 20th day of September 1905.
Metcalfe and Jurey
Attorney for Petitioner
In the United States Circuit Court for the Ninth Circuit Dirstrict of Washington Northern Division
Donald Mc. Kerracher, Petitioner.Petitioners for Appeal and Order all.... Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 18 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep.
In the United States Circuit Court for the Ninth Circuit Dirstrict of Washington Northern Division
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. No. 1328.
Praecipe For Transcript.
To the lerk of the above entitled Court:

You are requested and directed to prepare a record upon appeal in the above entitled proceeding and duly transmit the same to the Untied States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, to the City of San Fransisco, State of California, to the Clerk thereof: said record to include a full and complete copy of the following pleadings and papers, together with all endorsements thereon:
Petition for Writ of AHabeas Corpus,
Writ of Habeas Corpus,
Return of said Writ
Motion to Quash said Writ,
Memorandum of Judge's Decision,
Order of Discharge,
Exceptions of United States Attorney,
Petition for Appeal and Order allowing same,
Assignment of Errors,
Citation,
This praecipe and the original of the Citation.
Order allwoing United States to Intervene
Jesse A. Fraye,
United States Attorney.
Due and timety service of the within Praecipe for Transcript, adn the receipt of a true copy thereof, acknowledged this 20th day of September 1905.
Metcalfe and Jurey, Attorneys for petitioner.
In the United States Cirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner.
Praceipe for Transcript
Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 18 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep.
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte:
Donald Mc. Kerracher,
Petitioner.
Assignment of Errors.

Comes now the United States and Charles B. Hopkins, United States Marshal for the Western Distrcxit of Washington, appelants in the above entitled proceeding, by their attorney, Jesse A Frye, United States Attorney for the Western Distrcit of Washington, and in connection with their appeal herein say; that in the record and proceeding in the above entitled matter and in the order and judgement rendered and entered herein on the 20th day of September 1908, there is manifest error, in this, to-wit:
I. That Court erred in finding that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, was wrongfully restrained of his liberty,
II. The Court erred in finding that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, was unlawfully held in custody by the United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington.
III. The Cout erred in holding and finding that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, was unlawfully held in custody by the Warden of the United States Penitentiary on McNeil's Island, Washington.
IV.The Cout erred in ordering and directing the United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington to discharge said Donald McKerracher from custody and imprisonment.

V. That The Court erred in ordering and adjusting that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, was entitled to be discharged from the cusotdy of the United States Marshal for the Western District of Wahsington.
VI. That the Court erred in ordering and directing the United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington to discharge said Donald McKerracher from custody and imprisonment.
VII. That The Court erred in ordering and adjusting that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, be discharged from the United States penitentiary on McNeil's Island.
VIII. That The Court erred in ordering and adjusting that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, from the custody of officers of the United States.
IX. That The Court erred in ordering and adjusting that the petitioner, Donald Mc Keeracher, from the custody of officers of the United States and restoring him to his liberty.

X. That the Court erred in entering the order and judgement of September 20, 1905, in the premises, discharging the petitioner, Donald McKerracher, from the custody of the United States officers and restoring him to his liberty, for the reason that said order and judgement is not supported by the law in the premises, and that said order and judgement of discharge is contrary to law.

Wherefore, the United States Marshal for the Western Distrcit of Washington, and the United States of America, appellants, pray that their assignment of errors be entered upon the record in this proceeding:

And they further pray that, upon the hearing of this appeal it may be adjusted by the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, that the order and judgment in this proceeding made and entered on the 20th day of September 1905 be in all things held in naught, and that the petitioner, Donald McKerracher, be remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, and that he be imprisoned in the United States penitentiary on McNeill's Island, State of Washington, and there held until his term of sentence expires according to law.
Jesse A Frye
United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington, and Attorney for Appellees.
Due and timely service of the within Exceptions, and the receipt of a true copyh thereof, acknowledged this 20th day of September 1905.
Metcalfe and Jurey, Attorneys for Petitioner.
In the United States is admitted this, in Circuit Court of Dirstrict of Washington Ninth Judicial Circuit Northern Division

Donald Mc. Kerracher, Petitioner. Complainant vs. Defendant. Petition for a writ of Habeas Corpus. Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 20 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep.
In the United StatesCirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. no. 1328
Answer in return to the Writ of Habeas Corpus.

In obedience to theWrit of habeas corpus issued on behaf of the petitioner herein, comes now the respondent, Charles B. Hopkins United States Marshal for the Western Distrcit of Washington, and Jesse A. Frye, United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington appearting for the United States intervening herein, and for the said Charles B. Hopkins, United States Marshal for the Western Distrcit of Washington, and in answer to said writ and petition filed herein, certify, return and answer as follows:

1. Answering paragraph one of said petition, these respondents admit that the petitioner is a citizen of the Untied States and of the State of Washington, and they deny generally and each and every part thereof contained in said paragraph one of said petition.

II. Answering paragraph two of said petition, these respondents admit the allegations therein contained, except the allegation in the words and figures following, to-wit: " Which deduction under the law of the United amounts to eight (8) days for the each month of his sentence", which allegation these respondents deny generally and specifically, and each and every part thereof.
III. Respondents answering paragraph three of said petition, admit the allegations thereof.

IV. Answering paragraph four of said petition, these respondents deny generally and specifically each and every allegation therein contained, and eacfh and every part thereof: except that the respondents admit that the United States Marshal for the Western Distrcit of Washington refuses to discharge the petitioner from said penitentiary.

V. Answering paragraph five of said petition, these respondents admit that teh petitioner is entitled to the benefits of the laws of the United States in force at the time of his sentence and incarceration; and the respondents deny generally and specifically each and every allegation and each and every part thereof further contained in said paragraph five of said petitions.
Respondents further answering, and for further return to said Writ state:

I. That the respondents Charles B. Hopkins, is now and for a long time has been, the duly appointed qualified and acting United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, and that the petitioner, Donald McKerracher, is in his custody as such United States Marshal, and that the said petitioner is now detained in the United States Penitentiary on McNeil's Island.

II. That said petitioner was turned over to this respondent, Charles B. Hopkins, by his predecessor in Office, as United States Marshal for the then District of Washington, for the purpose of Incarceration in the United States penitentiary on McNeil's Island, in the then District of Washington, and on the 15th day of January 1902 under a sentence of imprisonment for the term of five years, by the United States District Court for the District of Washington, on the 14th day of January 1902, and on said 15th day of January 1902 said Donald McKerracher was duly imprisoned in the United States penitentiary on McNeil's Island in the State of Washington, and the said petitioner has since said date been held and confined in said penitentiary under said sentence, and is now detained therein under sentence, and which said sentence was duly and alwfully made by a court having jurisdiction of said petitioner, and that the commitment on said sentence was duly and lawfully issued, and that the imprisonment of said petitioner is lawful and according to law, and that said sentence of imprsionment has not expired and will not expire until the 14th day of April 1906. Wherefore, your respondents having shown to this Honorable cout that said petitioner is held by due and lawful process, nevertheless now produces before this honorable court, the body of said Donald McKerracher, petitioner herein, at the time and at the place as in said writ directed, and hereto attaches and makes a part of the return of said writ as upon the respondent Charles B. Hopkins served, and prays that said writ be denied, that the said petitioner be held to wait the expiration of his sentence as provided by law, and that the be remanded to the custody of the respondent Charles B. Hopkins, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington.
Jesse A. Frye. United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington.
Due and timely service of the within Answer, and the receipt of a true copyh thereof, acknowledged this 20th day of September 1905.
Metcalfe and Jurey, Attorneys for Petitioner.
In the United States is admitted this, in Circuit Court of Dirstrict of Washington Ninth Judicial Circuit Northern Division
In Re. Ex Parte. Donald Mc. Kerracher, Petitioner. Answer ......Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 20 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep.
In the United StatesCirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. No. 1328
Motion to Dismiss and Quash the Writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable Cornelius H. Hanford,

Comes now Jesse A. Frye, United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington, appearing for the United States of America intervening herein, and for Charles B. Hopkins, United States Marshal aforesaid, upon the petition, writ and return herein moves that the writ of habeas corpus heretofore issued herein be quashed and dismissed, on the following grounds to-wit:
I. That said writ was improvidently issued,

II. That it appears from the petition, writ and return herein that the said petitioner, Donald McKerracher, is in the legal custody of Charles B. Hopkins, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington.

III> That it appears from said petition, writ and return that the said petitioner, Donald McKerracher, was sentenced to five years imprisonment in the United States Penitentiary on McNeil's Island, Washington, on the 14th day of January 1902, by the Honorable Judge of the United States District Court for the Distrcit of Washington, and that on the 15th day of January 1902 in pursuance of said sentence the said petitioner was placed in the custody of the United States Marshal for the then District of Washington, was placed in the United States penitentiary on McNeil's Island, Washington, where said petuitoner has since been confined in pursuance of said sentence.
IV. That it appears from said petition, writ and return, that the said sentence so imposed by the said court as aforesaid has not expired by law, and will not expire until the 14th day of April 1906.

V. That is is established by the petition, writ and return, that the petitioner, Donald McKerrracher, is not entitled to the be discharged at this time from the custody of the said United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, that said sentence so imposed as foretold has not expired according to law.
Jesse A. Frye. Unired States Attorney for the Western District of Washington.
Due and timely service of the within motion, and the receipt of a true copyh thereof, acknowledged this 20th day of September 1905.
Metcalfe and Jurey, Attorneys for Petitioner.
In the United States is admitted this, in Circuit Court of Dirstrict of Washington Ninth Judicial Circuit Northern Division
In Re. Ex Parte. Donald Mc. Kerracher, Petitioner. ......Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 20 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep.
In the United States Cirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. No. 1328
Order.

On this 20th day of September 1905 comes Jesse A Frye, United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington, and the moves that the United States of America be given leave to intervene and defend the said petition and writ heretofore filed and issued in the premises; and the Court being fully advised in the premises, and all things here understood:
Now, Therefore, it is hereby ordered and adjusted that the United States of America be, and hereby is, given leave to intervene and defend the petition and writ heretofore filed and issued herein.
Done in open Court this 20th day of September 1905.
C.H. Hanford, Judge.
Due and timely service of the within Order, and the receipt of a true copyh thereof, acknowledged this 20th day of September 1905.
Metcalfe and Jurey, Attorneys for Petitioner.
In the United States is admitted this, in Circuit Court of Dirstrict of Washington Ninth Judicial Circuit Northern Division
In Re. Ex Parte. Donald Mc. Kerracher, Petitioner. Order.Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 20 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep.
In Cirtuit Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. No. 1328. Order of Discharge.
To the Honorable C.B. Hopkins, United States Marshal:

It is hereby ordered and directed that the above entitled matter having come on regularly to be heard before this court on the 20th day of September A.D. 1905, Donald McKerracher, the petitioner herein, being represented by his counsel, Mesare, Metcalfe and Jurey, and the United States of America being represented by the United States Attorney for this District, Jesse A. Frye, and all the matters therein involved being duly heard, and the court fully advised in the premisesm this Court has regularly held and determined that Donald McKerracher, a prisoner now held in custody by you at the penitentiary at McNeil's Island, in the State of Washington, is unlawfully held in custody, his term of imprisonment having expired as provided by law.
Therefore, you are hereby ordred and directed to forthwith discharge from custody and imprisonment the said Donald McKerracher.
Done in open Court this 20th day of September, 1905.
Attest: A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk. By Hm Briker, Deputy Clerk.
C.H. Hanford, Judge.
In the United States Cirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. No. 1328
Order.
In the United States is admitted this, in Circuit Court of Dirstrict of Washington Ninth Judicial Circuit Northern Division
In re. Ex Parte, Donald Mc. Kerracher, Petitioner. Order of Discharge. Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 20 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep.
In the United States Cirtuit Court, For the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. No. 1328
Bond.

We, M.W. Andrews and Mary Mo Kerracher, jointly and severally acknowledge ourselves indebted to the United States of America, in the sum of fifteen hundred, ($1500.00), dollars, lawful money of the United States of America to the levied on our, and each of our goods, , lands and tenants, upon this condition:

Whereas, Charles B. Hopkins, United States Marshall for Western District of Washington and United States of America, respondents in the above entitled matter, by their Attorney, Jesse A. Frye, United States Attorney for Western Distrcit of Washington, feeling and deeming themselves aggrevied, by the Order and judgement or discharge xxx entered and filed in the above entitled proceedings, on the 20th day of September, 1905, of the above petitioner, nad have appealed from said Order and Judgement of discharge, to United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit,

Now, if the said Donald Mc Kerracher shall appear and surrender himself in the Circuit Court of United States for the Western Distrcit of Washington, Northern Division, on and after filing in the said Circuit Court of the mande of said Circuit Court of Appeals, and from time to time thereafter as he may be required to further proceedings and abide by and perform a judgement or order,

which may be had or entered therein in this case and shall abide by and perform a judgement or order, which may not be rendered in the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and not depart from said Circuit Court, without leave thereof, then this obligation shall be void, otherwise to remain in full force and virtue.
Witness our hands and seals this 21st day of September A.D. 1905.
Taken and approved this 21st day of September, A.D. 1905, before me.
C.H. Hanford, District Judge.
In the United States Circuit Court for the Ninth Circuit Dirstrict of Washington Northern Division

Donald Mc. Kerracher, Petitioner. Complainant vs. Defendant. Bond. Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Sept 18 1905. Clerk by Deputy A. Reeves Ayres. A.N. Moody Dep. Metcafe 7 Jurey, Room 417, etc., Pacific Block, Seattle, Wash. Attorneys for Petitioners.
